node.title: U.S. man sentenced to death for "revenge killing" of woman in China
node.description: Shadeed Abdulmateen allegedly stabbed the woman to death on the night of June 14, 2021 with a folding knife.

node.title: Watch Live: Marjorie Taylor Greene testifies against challenge to her candidacy
node.description: The Georgia member of Congress is testifying in an administrative court.

node.title: Russian Olympic gold medalist banned for attending Putin rally
node.description: Rylov stood on stage with with medalists from other Olympic sports and wore a jacket with a "Z" on the chest.

node.title: FAA: YouTuber deliberately crashed plane for video
node.description: Jacob said the engine failed, but prior to jumping out of the plane, he put on a parachute, made no attempts to restart the engine, look for areas to land nor did he try to contact Traffic Control on the emergency frequency, the FAA says.

node.title: U.N. rights agency details "horror story" of violations against civilians in Ukraine
node.description: "Over these eight weeks, international humanitarian law has not merely been ignored but seemingly tossed aside," a U.N. spokesperson said.

node.title: How we make and buy clothes is hurting the planet. Here's a solution.
node.description: To fight climate change, apparel brands like Lululemon, Eileen Fisher and Patagonia are making it easier to resell their items.

node.title: How to tell if companies are living up to their eco-friendly promises
node.description: That "vegan" shampoo in a bottle "made of recycled materials" might not be as eco-friendly as you think.

node.title: Russia aims to take "full control" of southern Ukraine, general says
node.description: Moscow wants to seize all of southern Ukraine, far wider war aims than it had acknowledged as it presses on with a new offensive

node.title: Biden seeks to protect old-growth forests from wildfire
node.description: Old-growth trees provide carbon sinks that absorb carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases.

node.title: What are cryptocurrencies, and how do they work?
node.description: Digital currency and blockchain technology are still fuzzy concepts to many Americans — here are some key concepts.

node.title: Dentist arrested, allegedly hired hit men to kill sister's ex-husband
node.description: Wendi Adelson had told authorities that her brother had joked about hiring a hit man as a divorce present but had decided instead to buy her a TV.

node.title: How to keep your gadgets from choking the planet
node.description: Electronic waste is the fastest growing type of trash. Here's how to ensure your devices won't end up in a landfill.

node.title: In Maddie McCann case, child sex offender declared an official suspect
node.description: Police in Germany revealed in 2020 that the prime suspect was a child sex offender who was already in jail there — and that they believed he had killed her.

node.title: McCarthy considered telling Trump to resign after Jan. 6, recording shows
node.description: The House minority leader allegedly told GOP leaders, "I've had it with this guy," according to a New York Times report.

node.title: "The Dexter Killer:" Inside the mind of a murderer
node.description: A look at the evidence in "The Dexter Killer" case; plus, newly revealed letters from the man police say wanted to be like fictional serial-killer Dexter Morgan.

node.title: Heard's lawyer focuses on Depp's texts: "Let's burn Amber"
node.description: Depp has been on the stand in Fairfax County Circuit Court since Tuesday afternoon.

node.title: Governor calls off execution of Tennessee's oldest death row inmate at 11th hour
node.description: The governor said the execution will not move forward Thursday night.

node.title: Kamala Harris to give Tennessee State University commencement address
node.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is the first HBCU graduate to serve as president or vice president.

node.title: Texas executes its oldest death row inmate. He was 78.
node.description: Carl Wayne Buntion, 78, was put to death at the state penitentiary in Huntsville. He was condemned for the June 1990 fatal shooting of Houston police officer James Irby, a nearly 20-year member of the force.

node.title: Israeli police in riot gear storm Jerusalem holy site after rock-throwing
node.description: A recent escalation of tensions has raised fears of a repeat of last year, when protests and violence in Jerusalem helped ignite an 11-day war between Israel and Hamas.

node.title: College pitcher "no longer on the team" after tackling baserunner
node.description: The incident sparked a brawl that was captured on video.

node.title: Why the U.S. hasn't figured out plastics recycling
node.description: It isn't all would-be recyclers' fault.

node.title: Fewer Americans see climate change as priority than they did a year ago
node.description: Climate change is more of a priority for Democrats than Republicans; they divide on approach U.S. should take on energy policy.

node.title: Landscape trees spawn invaders "worse than murder hornets!"
node.description: The popular tree creates dense thickets that overwhelm native plants and bear four-inch spikes that can flatten tractor tires.

node.title: Doug Jones on bleak prospects for Senate Democrats in midterms
node.description: On "The Takeout" podcast this week, the former Alabama senator talks with host Major Garrett about Democrats and the midterms, the Supreme Court confirmation hearings, Putin and war crimes.

node.title: How the environmental movement won with acid rain
node.description: Scientists and policymakers turned what once was considered a "serious environmental problem" into a success story.

node.title: German prosecutors name official suspect in Madeleine McCann case
node.description: Police in Germany revealed in 2020 that the prime suspect was a child sex offender who was already in jail there — and that they believed he had killed her.

node.title: Korean leaders exchange friendly letters in rare break from tensions
node.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has exchanged letters with outgoing South Korean President Moon Jae-in and thanked him for trying to improve relations.

node.title: Teen jailed after 90-year-old's death to be paroled
node.description: A teen jailed for her part in the violent home invasion of a 90-year-old Levin woman, who died weeks later of a brain injury, will be released on parole.

node.title: Resale is bright light in environmentally costly fashion industry
node.description: Combating climate change, apparel brands like Lululemon, Eileen Fisher and Patagonia are making it easier to resell their items.
